alert.note: Alert for Owsley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 29 at 6:55AM EDT until July 30 at 5:36AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... The South Fork of the Kentucky River at Booneville, affecting Owsley County. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring. * WHERE...The Flood Warning is for the South Fork of the Kentucky River at Booneville. * WHEN...The Flood Warning is in effect until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 35.0 feet, water enters the basement of a home off of Highway 30 on the right bank of the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6 AM EDT Friday the stage was 33.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:00 AM EDT Friday was 34.2 feet at 2:30 AM. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 33.3 feet on 01/26/1978. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued by noon.
